Unbose

Subject can be a CSS selector (string), array (presumed to be of elements), element, document fragment or an Unbose object.

Summary
UnboseSubject can be a CSS selector (string), array (presumed to be of elements), element, document fragment or an Unbose object.
EventsMethods for handling event
clickAdds a click event to all elements in the set.
onAdd an event listener to all elements in the set.
onceAdd an event listener to all elements in the set that will be called once and then removed.
filterFilters the set of element by mathing them against the given selector.
Finding and traversingMethods for finding elements and traversing the DOM
findFind decendents of the elements that matches the given selector.
matchesSelectorCheck if an element matches a selector.
forEachCall a function for all elements in the set.
nameGet the element name of the first element in the set.
closestGet the closest element (current or ancestor) matching the given filter.
parentGet the elements parents.
childrenGet the elements child elements.
siblingsGet the siblings of the elements in the set.
firstGet the first element in the set.
lastGet the last element in the set.
prevGet the previous siblings of the elements in the set.
nextGet the next siblings of the elements in the set.
nthReturns the nth element in the set.
elemGets the HTMLElement for the nth element in the set if the index parameter is given.
DOMMethods for manipulating and “querying” the DOM
hasClassCheck if the elements in the set has a specific class.
addClassAdd a class to all elements in the set.
delClassRemoves a class from all elements in the set.
toggleClassAdd class name if it’s not set, remove it otherwise.
appendAppend an element, an Unbose object, a template or a zen string.
insertInsert an element, an Unbose object, a template or a zen string.
attrSet or get an attribute value.
emptyRemove all children of the elements in the set.
removeRemove the set of elements.
textSet or get the text of elements.
valSet or get the value of elements.
dataAssociate data with this element.
StyleMethods for getting and setting style for elements
styleSet or get a CSS property.
widthGets or sets the width of elements.
heightGets or sets the height of elements.
hideHides the elements.
showShows the elements.
Static methodsStatic Unbose methods
Unbose. tplFromZenConverts a template array to an element (NOT to an unbose object atm).
Unbose. eleFromZenCreate an HTML element from a zencode string.
Unbose. fromZenCreate an Unbose object from a zencode string.
Static helper methodsVarious helper methods
Unbose.listConvert something to a list.
Unbose. isArrayCheck if an object is an array.
Unbose. isFunctionCheck if an object is a function.
Unbose. isElementCheck if an object is an element.
Unbose.trimTrim leading and trailing whitespace in a string.
Unbose.nopEmpty function.
Support
classListWhether or not the user-agent support classList for elements

Events

Methods for handling event

click

click: function(handler,
capturing)

Adds a click event to all elements in the set.  Shorthand for ele.on(“click”, callback).

Parameters

handlerFunction called when the event occurs
capturingUse capturing

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

on

on

on: function(names,
handler,
capture)

Add an event listener to all elements in the set.

Parameters

namesName of the event.  To attach multiple event handlers, just separate them with a space.
handlerFunction called when event occurs
captureUse capturing

Returns

An Unbose object

once

once: function(names,
handler,
capture)

Add an event listener to all elements in the set that will be called once and then removed.  If multiple events are supplied, all will be removed once one of them is triggered.

Parameters

namesName of the event.  To attach multiple event handlers, just separate them with a space.
handlerFunction called when event occurs
captureUse capturing

Returns

An Unbose object

filter

filter: function(selector)

Filters the set of element by mathing them against the given selector.

Parameters

selectorThe selector to filter the set against.

Returns

An Unbose object

Finding and traversing

Methods for finding elements and traversing the DOM

find

find: function(selector)

Find decendents of the elements that matches the given selector.

Parameters

selectorSelector used to find matching elements

Returns

An Unbose object

matchesSelector

matchesSelector: function(selector)

Check if an element matches a selector.  Only checks the first element in a set.

Parameters

selectorSelector to match the element against

Returns

True if the element matches the selector, false otherwise

Caveats

This matcher is a lot less sophisticated than a native one would be.  Currently the following selectors are supported:

  • Element names
  • Class names
  • IDs
  • Chains of the above
  • Multiple selectors separated by comma

forEach

forEach: function(func,
context)

Call a function for all elements in the set.

Parameters

funcThe function to call
context(optional) context, the value of `this` for the function calls

Returns

An Unbose object

TODO

Should we pass ele or Unbose object to args?

name

name: function()

Get the element name of the first element in the set.

Returns

The name of the first element in the set.  Name will always be lower case when returned.

closest

closest: function(filter)

Get the closest element (current or ancestor) matching the given filter.

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

parent

parent

parent: function(filter)

Get the elements parents.

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

children

children

children: function(filter)

Get the elements child elements.

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

parent

siblings

siblings: function(filter)

Get the siblings of the elements in the set.

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

first

first: function()

Get the first element in the set.

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

last, nth

last

last: function()

Get the last element in the set.

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

first, nth

prev

prev: function(filter)

Get the previous siblings of the elements in the set.

Returns

An Unbose object

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

See also

next

next

next: function(filter)

Get the next siblings of the elements in the set.

Parameters

filterA selector that filters the results

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

prev

nth

nth: function(index)

Returns the nth element in the set.

Parameters

indexThe index of the element in the set

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

first, last

elem

elem: function(index)

Gets the HTMLElement for the nth element in the set if the index parameter is given.  Otherwise, gets an array of all HTMLElements in the set.

Parameters

indexThe index of the element in the set

Returns

An HTMLElement or and array of HTMLElements

Fixme

Should the retval with no args be the array or a copy of it?

DOM

Methods for manipulating and “querying” the DOM

hasClass

hasClass: function(cls)

Check if the elements in the set has a specific class.

Parameters

clsThe class name to check for

Returns

True if all the elements in the set has the class, false othwerwise

See also

delClass, addClass, toggleClass

addClass

addClass: function(cls)

Add a class to all elements in the set.

Parameters

clsA space separated list of class names to add to the element

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

delClass, hasClass, toggleClass

delClass

delClass: function(cls)

Removes a class from all elements in the set.

Parameters

clsA space separated list of class names to remove from the element

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

addClass, hasClass, toggleClass

toggleClass

toggleClass: function(cls)

Add class name if it’s not set, remove it otherwise.

Parameters

clsThe class name to toggle

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

addClass, hasClass, delClass

append

append: function(thing)

Append an element, an Unbose object, a template or a zen string.  Append adds the element after the last child element. append(thing) is a cleaner shorthand for insert(thing, true)

Note that when appending an element to several elements, event listeners will be removed.

Parameters

thingThing to add

Returns

An Unbose object

See also

insert

insert

insert: function(thing,
append)

Insert an element, an Unbose object, a template or a zen string.  By default, add it as the first child of the parent.  If the append argument is true, the element is appended as the last child element instead.

Note that when inserting an element to several elements, event listeners will be removed.

Parameters

thingThing to add
appendAppend instead of insert

Returns

An Unbose object

attr

attr: function(name,
val)

Set or get an attribute value.  If value is given, set it.  Of not, just return current value.  On getting, if the attribute does not exist, return undefined.

Parameters

nameAttribute to get or set
val(optional) Value to set to

Returns

An Unbose object or an attribute

empty

empty: function()

Remove all children of the elements in the set.

Returns

An Unbose object

remove

remove: function()

Remove the set of elements.

Returns

An Unbose object

TODO

Support expression arg

text

text: function(text)

Set or get the text of elements.  If the text argument is given, the text content of all elements in the set is updated.  If the text argument is not given, it returns the text content of the first element in the set.

Parameters

text(optional) New text content

Returns

An Unbose object or a string

val

val: function(val)

Set or get the value of elements.  If the val argument is given, the value of all elements in the set is updated.  If the val argument is not given, it returns the value of the first element in the set.

Parameters

val(optional) The value to set

Returns

An Unbose object

TODO

This might need some special-casing for some elements.  Need to look into that.

data

data: function(name,
val)

Associate data with this element.  The value will be converted to a string.

Parameters

nameThe name to get or set
val(optional) The value of the attribute to set

Returns

If a value is set, it returns an Unbose object, otherwise, it returns the value.

Style

Methods for getting and setting style for elements

style

style: function(attr,
value)

Set or get a CSS property.

Parameters

attrName of style attribute
value(optional) new value of style attribute

Returns

An Unbose object or a string

width

width: function(value)

Gets or sets the width of elements.

Parameters

value(optional) Sets the width of the element

Returns

The width of the element, without padding and borders, in pixels

height

height: function(value)

Gets or sets the height of elements.

Parameters

value(optional) Sets the height of the element

Returns

The height of the element, without padding and borders, in pixels

hide

hide: function()

Hides the elements.

Returns

An Unbose object

show

show: function()

Shows the elements.

Returns

An Unbose object

Static methods

Static Unbose methods

Unbose. tplFromZen

Unbose.tplFromZen = function(zen)

Converts a template array to an element (NOT to an unbose object atm).

Unbose. eleFromZen

Unbose.eleFromZen = function(zen)

Create an HTML element from a zencode string.

Parameters

zenthe string of zencode

Returns

HTMLElement

See also

<fromZen>

Unbose. fromZen

Unbose.fromZen = function(zen)

Create an Unbose object from a zencode string.

Parameters

zenthe string of zencode

Returns

Unbose element of zencode

See also

<eleFromZen>

Static helper methods

Various helper methods

Unbose.list

Unbose.list = function()

Convert something to a list.  Takes an arbitrary number of arguments.  Useful e.g. for converting the arguments object to an array to use array methods.

Parameters

An arbitrary number of parameters

Returns

An array

Unbose. isArray

Unbose.isArray = function(obj)

Check if an object is an array.

Parameters

objthe object to check

Returns

boolean, true if object is an array.  Otherwise false.

Note

Copied from

http://perfectionkills.com- /instanceof-considered-harmful-or-how-to-write-a-robust-isarray- /

Unbose. isFunction

Unbose.isFunction = function(obj)

Check if an object is a function.

Parameters

objthe object to check

Returns

boolean, true if object is a function.  Otherwise false.

Unbose. isElement

Unbose.isElement = function(obj)

Check if an object is an element.

Parameters

objthe object to check

Returns

boolean, true if object is an element.  Otherwise false.

Unbose.trim

Unbose.trim = function(text)

Trim leading and trailing whitespace in a string.

Parameters

textThe text to be trimmed

Returns

The trimmed text

Unbose.nop

Unbose.nop = function()

Empty function.  Can be useful in cases where a function is required.

Support

classList

classList: (
   function() { var ele = document.createElement("div"); return !!ele.classList; }
)() }

Whether or not the user-agent support classList for elements
